title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
short_summary: An obsessive captain hunts a white whale.
full_summary: Captain Ahab’s monomaniacal pursuit of the great whale consumes his crew and himself; the novel explores fate, obsession, and the limits of knowledge.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
short_summary: A student commits murder and faces his conscience.
full_summary: Raskolnikov tests a theory that extraordinary people may transgress, but guilt and moral reckoning unravel him in a psychological study of crime and redemption.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
short_summary: Russian lives entangled during the Napoleonic wars.
full_summary: Across families and battlefields, Tolstoy examines history, love, and free will while following Pierre, Natasha, and Andrei through sweeping upheaval.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
short_summary: A portrait bears a man’s moral decay.
full_summary: Dorian remains outwardly youthful while his hidden portrait grotesquely records his sins; a gothic parable about vanity, influence, and conscience.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
short_summary: A scientist creates life, then recoils from it.
full_summary: Victor Frankenstein assembles a living being but refuses responsibility; creator and creation destroy each other in a tale of ambition and isolation.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
short_summary: A vampire’s invasion threatens Victorian England.
full_summary: Told through diaries and letters, the hunt for Count Dracula pits modern science and faith against an ancient predatory evil.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
short_summary: A governess seeks love and independence.
full_summary: Jane’s moral courage and desire for dignity carry her from hardship to Thornfield Hall, where a forbidden secret tests her principles.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
short_summary: A destructive love haunts two families.
full_summary: Heathcliff and Catherine’s passion curdles into vengeance across generations on the Yorkshire moors; a stark study of obsession and class.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_summary: A fellowship quests to destroy a corrupting ring.
full_summary: Hobbits and allies traverse Middle-earth, confronting power and sacrifice as the Ring’s burden tests courage, loyalty, and hope.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_summary: Myths and wars shaping Middle-earth’s First Age.
full_summary: Creation, rebellion, and tragic heroism unfold in interconnected legends that underpin Tolkien’s world and its long struggle against darkness.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
short_summary: A washed-up hacker attempts the ultimate cyberspace heist.
full_summary: Gibson’s cyberpunk classic fuses noir and networked futures, exploring AI, identity, and corporate power in a high-velocity caper.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
short_summary: A courier and a hacker battle a memetic virus.
full_summary: In a satirical near future, language, religion, and code collide as a new digital plague threatens minds both online and off.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
short_summary: An envoy on a world with fluid gender norms.
full_summary: A political mission becomes a story of trust and friendship as Genly Ai journeys across ice with Estraven, challenging assumptions about identity.

title: A Wizard of Earthsea
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
short_summary: A young mage confronts a shadow he unleashed.
full_summary: Ged’s pride opens a breach he must heal through humility and balance; a quiet, profound coming-of-age fantasy.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
short_summary: A gifted child is trained for interstellar war.
full_summary: Ender’s brutal schooling and empathy intertwine in a twist on leadership and the cost of victory.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
short_summary: An astronaut improvises to survive on Mars.
full_summary: Stranded after a mission failure, Mark Watney relies on engineering grit and humor in a science-savvy survival tale.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
short_summary: A plan predicts the fall of a galactic empire.
full_summary: Hari Seldon’s psychohistory guides centuries of crises as scholars and traders shepherd civilization through dark ages.

title: Hyperion
author: Dan Simmons
short_summary: Pilgrims tell linked tales on a doomed world.
full_summary: A Canterbury-style mosaic blends poetry, horror, and space opera around the mysterious Shrike and time-bending fate.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
short_summary: A father and son trek through a burned America.
full_summary: Sparse prose follows their fragile kindness amid ash and cruelty; a meditation on love, survival, and moral fire.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
short_summary: A missing wife; a marriage of deceptions.
full_summary: Alternating voices peel back manipulation and media spectacle in a twisty psychological thriller.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
short_summary: A journalist and hacker probe a decades-old disappearance.
full_summary: Lisbeth Salander’s ferocity meets corporate rot and family secrets in a dark Scandinavian mystery.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
short_summary: Murders in a medieval monastery’s labyrinthine library.
full_summary: Scholar-detective William of Baskerville navigates theology, politics, and books as dangerous as weapons.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Cixin Liu
short_summary: First contact triggers a centuries-long game.
full_summary: Physics puzzles and cultural history converge as humanity faces a patient, ruthless alien intelligence.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
short_summary: Childhood betrayal shadows a man’s return to Kabul.
full_summary: Amir seeks redemption across war-torn decades, exploring guilt, friendship, and the possibility of atonement.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
short_summary: A boy and a tiger share a lifeboat.
full_summary: A survival fable that questions truth, storytelling, and faith on an ocean of ambiguity.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
short_summary: A girl steals words to survive Nazi Germany.
full_summary: Narrated by Death, Liesel finds meaning through books and love amid everyday heroism and loss.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
short_summary: Rival magicians bound to a mysterious circus.
full_summary: A slow-burn romance entwines with whimsical set pieces in a contest where love must rewrite the rules.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
short_summary: Old gods clash with new in modern America.
full_summary: Shadow journeys through a myth-soaked road novel where belief shapes reality and identity.

title: Good Omens
author: Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
short_summary: An angel and a demon try to stop Armageddon.
full_summary: A warm, witty romp about friendship, free will, and very British apocalypse logistics.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
short_summary: A heist to overthrow an immortal tyrant.
full_summary: Allomancy powers fuel a rebellion led by a street thief learning trust, leadership, and her own limits.

title: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon Sanderson
short_summary: Shattered oaths and storm-lashed wars on Roshar.
full_summary: Multiple POVs build an epic about honor, trauma, and the weight of ideals in a broken world.

title: The Lies of Locke Lamora
author: Scott Lynch
short_summary: Con artists play a deadly long game.
full_summary: The Gentleman Bastards mix swagger and sorrow in a Venetian-like city where loyalty is the ultimate gamble.

title: The Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
short_summary: A boy protects a forgotten book in postwar Barcelona.
full_summary: A literary mystery where love, memory, and obsession coil around a cursed author’s legacy.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
short_summary: Expatriates seek meaning after WWI.
full_summary: Bullfights, cafés, and restrained prose sketch disillusionment and desire among the Lost Generation.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
short_summary: War’s absurdity traps airmen in a paradox.
full_summary: Dark satire turns bureaucracy into a machine that devours reason, survival, and language itself.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
short_summary: A family saga steeped in magical realism.
full_summary: Macondo’s cyclical history blends wonder and tragedy as the Buendías chase love and oblivion.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
short_summary: A haunting legacy of slavery intrudes on the present.
full_summary: Sethe confronts memory, motherhood, and a ghost that embodies trauma and love.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
short_summary: Letters trace resilience and self-discovery.
full_summary: Celie finds voice, solidarity, and freedom in a tale of abuse, faith, and chosen family.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
short_summary: A stolen painting shadows a boy’s life.
full_summary: Theo drifts through grief, art, and crime in a sprawling meditation on beauty and attachment.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
short_summary: Two people struggle to connect over years.
full_summary: Intimate, clear-eyed prose follows class, power, and miscommunication in a modern on-again, off-again bond.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
short_summary: A painter stops speaking after a shocking crime.
full_summary: A psychotherapist pursues the truth behind silence in a slick, twisty psychological thriller.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
short_summary: A marsh girl grows up alone; a murder divides a town.
full_summary: Naturalist detail and courtroom drama frame a coming-of-age about abandonment, love, and survival.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
short_summary: Classics students commit a crime and unravel.
full_summary: An elegant campus thriller about beauty, guilt, and the corrosive allure of elite circles.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
short_summary: A man’s search for his wife opens strange doors.
full_summary: Suburban mysteries bleed into war memories and surreal encounters in a dreamlike investigation of loss.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
short_summary: A coming-of-age love story tinged with grief.
full_summary: Tender realism explores mental health, intimacy, and the pull between memory and moving on.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
short_summary: Parallel quests entwine fate, cats, and prophecy.
full_summary: A runaway boy and an old man cross stories in a lyrical puzzle about identity and metaphysics.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
short_summary: A human survives Earth’s demolition and hitchhikes space.
full_summary: Cheerfully absurd adventures lampoon bureaucracy, philosophy, and towels in equal measure.

title: The Colour of Magic
author: Terry Pratchett
short_summary: A cowardly wizard tours a flat world on a turtle.
full_summary: Discworld begins with comic fantasy that sends up sword-and-sorcery while sneaking in heart.

title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
author: Neil Gaiman
short_summary: Childhood memories stir ancient forces.
full_summary: A quiet, uncanny fairy tale about memory, sacrifice, and the magic adults forget.

title: Station Eleven
author: Emily St. John Mandel
short_summary: A pandemic links lives through art and survival.
full_summary: Before and after the collapse, a traveling troupe and a comic book keep meaning alive.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
short_summary: A lone astronaut must save the sun—and himself.
full_summary: Science puzzles, first-contact friendship, and gallows humor power an upbeat survival epic.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
short_summary: A brief history of humankind’s big leaps.
full_summary: From cognitive revolution to capitalism, Harari traces how shared stories shape societies. (Non-fiction)

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
short_summary: A woman escapes a survivalist upbringing through learning.
full_summary: A memoir of abuse, self-invention, and the power—and cost—of education. (Non-fiction)

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
short_summary: How two systems drive human judgment.
full_summary: Kahneman maps intuitive and analytical thinking, biases, and decision traps with enduring implications. (Non-fiction)

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
short_summary: Tiny changes compound into big results.
full_summary: A practical framework for building good habits and breaking bad ones through cues, routines, and environment. (Non-fiction)

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
short_summary: The loop behind habits in life and work.
full_summary: Stories and science explain cue-routine-reward and how to reshaping routines changes outcomes. (Non-fiction)

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
short_summary: The woman behind the HeLa cells that changed medicine.
full_summary: Biography, ethics, and family history intersect around consent and scientific progress. (Non-fiction)

title: The Devil in the White City
author: Erik Larson
short_summary: World’s Fair glamour and a serial killer’s shadow.
full_summary: Architecture, ambition, and true crime entwine in Gilded Age Chicago. (Non-fiction)

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
short_summary: A cathedral’s construction reshapes medieval lives.
full_summary: Politics, faith, and craftsmanship span decades in a richly plotted historical epic.

title: Shōgun
author: James Clavell
short_summary: A shipwrecked pilot navigates samurai politics.
full_summary: Culture clash and ruthless strategy drive a sweeping saga of power in feudal Japan.

title: The Hunt for Red October
author: Tom Clancy
short_summary: A submarine captain’s defection sparks a cat-and-mouse chase.
full_summary: Technical detail and Cold War stakes power a taut naval thriller.

title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
author: John le Carré
short_summary: A retired spy hunts a mole inside MI6.
full_summary: Quiet tradecraft and moral ambiguity define a masterclass in espionage fiction.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
short_summary: Kindergarten drama hides darker truths.
full_summary: Breezy wit layers over domestic violence and solidarity in a coastal community.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
short_summary: A teen witnesses a police shooting and finds her voice.
full_summary: Community, grief, and courage drive a timely coming-of-age. (YA)

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
short_summary: A witch from myth steps out of the margins.
full_summary: Circe forges her own power and compassion against gods and men in a lyrical retelling.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
short_summary: Patroclus narrates love and fate in the Iliad’s shadow.
full_summary: A tender, tragic romance reframes heroism and destiny at Troy.

author: George Orwell
short_summary: A dystopia about surveillance and control of truth.
full_summary: A totalitarian Party rewrites reality and polices thought; Winston tries to resist but is crushed by the system.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
short_summary: A 'stable' society engineered by conditioning and synthetic happiness.
full_summary: Stability is bought through genetic engineering, conditioning, and soma; individuality is sacrificed for comfort.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
short_summary: Books are burned to avoid difficult ideas.
full_summary: Fireman Guy Montag begins to question his role and the numbing effect of mass media and censorship.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
short_summary: A theocracy controls women's bodies.
full_summary: Offred serves as a Handmaid in Gilead; the novel explores control, language, and small acts of resistance.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_summary: Bilbo's journey beyond comfort into adventure.
full_summary: Bilbo joins dwarves to reclaim a treasure from Smaug and discovers courage, wit, and friendship.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
short_summary: Politics and ecology on desert planet Arrakis.
full_summary: House Atreides inherits Arrakis, source of spice; betrayal drives Paul into the desert to rise with the Fremen.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
short_summary: Love and status in Georgian England.
full_summary: Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy confront pride, prejudice, and social pressure around marriage and class.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
short_summary: Childhood and justice in the Jim Crow South.
full_summary: Through Scout, we watch Atticus Finch defend a Black man falsely accused; lessons on empathy and moral courage.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
short_summary: The American Dream and the illusion of happiness.
full_summary: Nick witnesses Gatsby’s obsession with Daisy amid Jazz Age glamour; beneath it lie illusion and loss.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
short_summary: An alienated teen searching for authenticity.
full_summary: Holden Caulfield wanders New York, wrestling with grief, phoniness, and the ache of growing up.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
short_summary: A quest toward one’s Personal Legend.
full_summary: Santiago follows omens toward a treasure, learning about love, purpose, and listening to the heart.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
short_summary: Talent, learning, and the cost of fame.
full_summary: Kvothe recounts music, magic, rivalries, and the shadowy Chandrian; a meditation on myth and memory.
